ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good class, well-structured, will recommend it if want to learn more about a different field of economics.
I definitely recommend. I would just say this is the best.
Yes, I would recommend this class.

This class is probably not worth it âÂ the material is very interesting, but Shiller's lectures are unfortunately so disorganized and lacking in substance that you're probably just better off reading the fantastic books assigned forthe class (Nudge, Thinking Fast and Slow, etc.)

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was an introduction course for me. Provided me with good overview.
Assigned papers and his materials deepened my knowledge a lot and will contribute to my work.

The content is useful in itself but also it is a great insight into how to think things through in general. The idea of thinking things through from various angles and pulling in useful ideas from other disciplines is a very transferrable principle.
